data.meta_description: Capital providers are increasingly demanding information about how companies are managing their exposure to climate-related risks and opportunities. Delve…
data.text:
The latest EY Climate Risk Barometer reveals a concerning disconnect between reported climate efforts and carbon ambitions. While there are incremental improvements in reporting, more needs to be done to support climate commitments. 74% of surveyed companies are not including the quantitative impacts of climate risk in their disclosures, leaving a gap between climate impact and corporate strategy. Climate related reporting should become more than just a “tick box” exercise for finance teams if we expect to make real progress toward our decarbonization goals. Read more: https://go.ey.com/46HoIuq #ClimateChange #ClimateRelatedReporting #BetterWorkingWorld Matthew Bell Velislava Ivanova
